epics.title: Enterprise Authentication and Access Management
epics.summary: Implement secure enterprise authentication and RBAC for the multi-cloud management platform.
epics.description: This epic covers the implementation of enterprise-grade user authentication and authorization mechanisms using SSO, SAML, or OAuth2 to allow users to securely log in. It includes the design of role-based access control (RBAC) policies for administrators, auditors, and operators. The system should ensure tenant isolation, enforced through identity federation and security compliance policies, so that users only see data and actions permitted by their roles.

epics.title: Cloud Account Onboarding and API Integration
epics.summary: Enable onboarding of AWS, Azure, GCP, and IBM Cloud accounts with secure API integration.
epics.description: This epic involves building workflows to securely onboard cloud accounts from AWS, Azure, GCP, and IBM Cloud using keys, credentials, or delegated roles. It defines standardized adapters to interact with each provider's APIs, ensuring consistent data ingestion and policy enforcement. The process should include automatic validation of credentials and health checks to maintain reliable access for resource discovery and management.

epics.title: Cloud Resource Discovery and Normalization
epics.summary: Automatically discover, aggregate, and normalize cloud resources across providers.
epics.description: This epic focuses on implementing resource discovery from multiple cloud providers to collect inventory data such as compute, storage, network, and security configurations. Normalization logic should convert provider-specific data into a unified model, enabling cross-cloud visibility. The system should refresh data periodically or on-demand and support tagging and categorization for efficient search and filtering.

epics.title: Personalized Dashboard and Visualization
epics.summary: Develop a role-based dashboard displaying cloud inventory, cost, security, and compliance data.
epics.description: This epic entails designing and implementing a personalized dashboard that visualizes aggregated data from all connected cloud accounts. The dashboard should present real-time metrics including cost summaries, security posture, compliance scores, and inventory views. Widgets and filters should adapt based on the user's role and permissions, ensuring both usability and data governance. It must serve as a single pane of glass for monitoring the entire cloud environment.

epics.title: Cost Optimization and Financial Insights
epics.summary: Provide analytics and recommendations to optimize cloud spending across providers.
epics.description: This epic covers the development of cost analytics engines to aggregate billing data, detect underutilized resources, and recommend optimization strategies. It should present forecasts, budgets, and trend analyses while integrating with the dashboard for visualization. Insights must be actionable, allowing users to trigger workflows such as instance resizing or scheduling shutdowns through connected automation tools.

epics.title: Security and Compliance Monitoring
epics.summary: Detect, analyze, and present security posture and compliance insights across all cloud accounts.
epics.description: This epic addresses the continuous monitoring of cloud environments against defined security baselines and compliance frameworks. It should support automatic detection of misconfigurations, vulnerabilities, and policy violations. Each finding must include rule-based explanations and remediation steps. Integration with compliance libraries and generation of audit-ready reports are also required to support enterprise governance standards.

epics.title: Governance and Automation Workflows Integration
epics.summary: Integrate with CI/CD and IaC tools to trigger governance and automation workflows.
epics.description: This epic focuses on building integrations with existing CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solutions such as Terraform or CloudFormation. It should allow users to trigger actions like environment creation, policy enforcement, or remediation directly from the platform. Policy-as-code governance must be supported to ensure consistent enforcement across multi-cloud environments. The system should provide feedback loops for automated change control and audit tracking.

epics.title: Real-Time Alerts and Notification System
epics.summary: Implement real-time monitoring, alerts, and notifications for cost, security, and compliance events.
epics.description: This epic aims to deliver a notification and alerting framework that monitors system and cloud metrics in real time. Users should receive configurable alerts for anomalies such as unexpected cost increases, policy violations, or security risks via email, Slack, or native integrations. Critical alerts must be actionable and linked directly to dashboards or workflows to facilitate immediate response and remediation.

epics.title: Audit Logging, History, and Reporting
epics.summary: Maintain auditable logs of all platform actions and provide reporting capabilities.
epics.description: This epic ensures that every user action, configuration change, and automated event is captured in detailed audit logs. Logs must be immutable, timestamped, and searchable by user, account, or resource. Reporting capabilities should include historical trend analysis and compliance documentation exports. This serves enterprise security, compliance, and investigation needs, guaranteeing accountability and traceability.

epics.title: Performance, Scalability, and Data Security Enhancements
epics.summary: Ensure the platform is scalable, secure, and high-performing under enterprise workloads.
epics.description: This epic involves optimizing the underlying architecture for high performance and scalability, ensuring responsiveness as the number of onboarded accounts and discovered resources grows. It includes implementing encryption at rest and in transit, enforcing data isolation per tenant, and stress-testing API integration layers. Performance metrics, scaling thresholds, and security validation checkpoints must be part of the CI/CD process to maintain a resilient multi-cloud operations platform.
